properties.areaDesc: Burns Harbor to Michigan City IN; Calumet Harbor IL to Gary IN; Gary to Burns Harbor IN
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 4 at 2:49PM CST until January 6 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Gale
Warning, which is in effect from noon Sunday to midnight CST
Sunday night. The Gale Watch is no longer in effect.

* WINDS...Northwest to 25 kt through early this evening. West
gales to 35 kt Sunday afternoon and evening with a few gusts to
40 kt.

* SIGNIFICANT WAVES...to 6 ft through early this evening and to 8
ft Sunday.

* OCCASIONAL WAVES...to 8 ft through early this evening and to 10
ft Sunday.
properties.instruction:
A Gale Warning means winds of 34 to 47 knots are imminent or
occurring. Operating a vessel in gale conditions requires
experience and properly equipped vessels. It is highly
recommended that mariners without the proper experience seek safe
harbor prior to the onset of gale conditions.

A Small Craft Advisory means that wind speeds of 21 to 33 knots
are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.
Inexperienced mariners...especially those operating smaller
vessels should avoid navigating in these conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...GALE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST SUNDAY NIGHT
